sentences.en: A sudden jarring or jerking, as from a heavy blow or an abrupt movement.
sentences.cn: 震动,摇动, 颠簸(如因受重击或猝然移动而产生的)突然震动或颠簸.

sentences.en: Alas , whatever expense comes up at midmonth will be completely unexpected and quite jarring.
sentences.cn: 其实月中的这笔花销一定是让你猝不及防的.

sentences.en: Amid these jarring events Collin felt one thing to be indispensable.
sentences.cn: 在这种龃龉的事件之中,克林觉得有一样事非办不可.

sentences.en: But then came the jarring moment , as breaking news intruded.
sentences.cn: 但是当出现突发新闻时,也出现了不和谐的声音.

sentences.en: In the context of this chapter, Dore's comments strike a jarring note.
sentences.cn: 在这一章的语境中，多尔的评论显得很尖刻。

sentences.en: Instead of something jarring , try subtle or soft movements similar to fade infadein a slide show.
sentences.cn: 你应当使用一些类似于放映幻灯片时淡入淡出之类微妙的或温和的运动,而不是那些嘈杂的东西.

sentences.en: Landing can be very jarring to a dancer and can cause injuries.
sentences.cn: 对舞蹈演员来说,落地会产生很的反弹力,也有可能因此受伤.

sentences.en: She allows that his love life had its jarring moments.
sentences.cn: 她承认加里波第的感情生活并不和谐.

sentences.en: Solid packing and overall stuffing can prevent the cases from vibration and jarring.
sentences.cn: 坚固的木箱和箱内严密的填充可防止木箱受震、开裂.

sentences.en: The book's tone is refreshing, although its occasional passages of lazy journalese can be jarring.
sentences.cn: 这本书的语调清新.尽管其中几段对懒惰新闻媒介的描写有点刺耳.

sentences.en: These two aspects, falling so close, will overlap and could be quite jarring.
sentences.cn: 这两个事件, 靠的太近, 将会重叠导致很多口角.

sentences.en: Though we experienced plenty chungchung from repaired highway expansion joints , the jarring never reached the cabin.
sentences.cn: 虽然我们经历了很多家中,家中从修复公路伸缩缝的不和谐从未达到机舱.

sentences.en: Two of them had been jarring at each other.
sentences.cn: 他们中的两个人一直争吵不休.

sentences.en: Two of them had been jarring with each other.
sentences.cn: 他们中的两个人一直在争吵不休.

sentences.en: WHEN two extremes come clashing together , you either get jarring mess, or absurd harmony.
sentences.cn: 当两种极端碰撞, 你得到不是激烈的冲突就是有趣的和谐之声.

words.tran_cn: 冲突；不一致；震惊；发刺耳声
不和谐的；[声]刺耳的；辗轧的
震惊；冲突；发刺耳声（jar的现在分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 玻璃缸，玻璃罐；玻璃瓶装
[口语](门等)微开着，半开半掩着

trans.tran_cn: 刺耳的，不和谐的，辗轧的
